result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:48 AM Defendant Morgan William Littel not in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Morgan William Littel.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requested warrant. Attorney Cuevas has been unable to contact defendant. Court granted warrant.

2:25 PM Defendant Morgan William Littel in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Morgan William Littel.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Cuevas requested more time to speak
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

02:12 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
